name: Louis Imperial Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Pathos and we wewre not disappointed,the hotel provided a nice room facing the sea ,clean and kept tidy. Food was excellent we were half board and all staff were helpful and polite. The entertainment was good if at times ratherv dated.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would use this hotel again without question.
reviews.title: lovely hotel but needs updating before it looses it's guests to other hotels

reviews.text: We stayed here for a week in june this year, having never been to Cyprus before and having read good reveiws of the Louis Imperial we were looking forward to our holiday there. We arrived about 10-30pm therefore we had missed the evening meal but found that the staff had left a selection of cold meats and cheeses in our room - nice touch we thought. We were given room 253 on the 2nd floor but the next morning we had to ask to be moved to another room as i could not sleep due to a loud continous droning noise coming from directly outside our room, the hotel reception staff were very helpful and gave us the keys to 2 other rooms and left us to choose the one we wanted, we chose room 235 on the same floor but further down the corridoor away from the noise - it even had a better sea veiw.
reviews.title: A good holiday but one or two issues

reviews.text: Now i'm a very picky eater and i usually exists on chicken every night of my holiday but the food at this hotel was fantastic-very tasty -lots of choice and beautiful desserts. My husband celebrated his birthday whilst we were there and after eating our meal the lights suddenly dimmed and the restaurant manager and staff came out carrying a huge flaming torch,a birthday cake and singing "happy birthday" to my husband -much to his surprise, this was a lovely thing to do and shows that the Louis Imperial go that extra step to make your holiday with they special.
reviews.title: NICE

reviews.text: Other reveiws say that the hotel is looking tired in places and could do with updating and we agree with this, the carpets need replacing in the bedrooms and corridors, the bathrooms are in need of refurbishing but everywhere is spotlessly clean (apart from the stairway that leads down to the indoor pool area) All of the staff from the cleaners, the bar staff and the reception staff are very friendly, helpful and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. If the hotel carried out a refurbishment it would make this hotel a truely wonderful place to stay, worthy of it's 4star rating and able to compete with the other 4 and 5 star hotels close by.
reviews.title: Fabulous Holiday

reviews.text: We moved to the Louis Imperial after our first hotel was not quite what we expected. The hotel in a 20 minute walk from the harbour along a pleasant costal path - great food in the harbour restaurants. The pool area was roasting hot so we chilled at the loungers overlooking the sea. Room was spacious and clean. Food was an all you can eat buffet which was ok for that type of "keep it warm under hot lights" arrangement. Down side was that if you wanted to swap your evening meal for a lunch meal, you had to sit in the impossible hot poolside area to eat. I cope well with heat but this was too much! So we got a sandwich from the little supermarket opposite and ate in our room. Most staff were lovely and very helpful. Good place to go if all you want to do is bake in the sun.
reviews.title: We moved to the Louis Imperial after our...

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks, it is in a dreadful state, and in need of a lot of investment, the water comes out at a dribble, the bathrroms are poor, cracked tiles and rotten doors. the curtain linerss were filthy, the carpet stained and the bed was iffy as the sheets didn't fit the matress and you ended up sleeping on the uncovered matress, not hygenic. The lifts were continually breaking down and there are no stairs that you would want to use except in an emergency, my wife was actually stuck in one on our last day. The lawn mower broke down so the quieter lawn was like a meadow, and the taped joints on the hedge trimmer cable on the main path to the beach was dangerous.
reviews.title: Delapidated hotel, not worth the money

reviews.text: Thomson advertise this as a 4 star hotel, and do not tell you that you will be tortured by a group of so called entertainers on and off all day until mid night playing thimpty thumpty music, I sat on my balcony with a sea view which we paid extra for and all I could hear is the loud noise from the outside stage thumpty thumty, had to wait until after midnight to hear the sea.
reviews.title: lovely hotel, amazing staff A+++

reviews.text: The staff were generally brilliant, the food was good, but I called the resteraunt a canteen as it did not give a resteraunt feel, I ate out most nights even though we had to go half board which we did not want. Thomson restrict your options.
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I feel this hotel is over rated, overpriced and a great dissapointment, there are far better hotels nearby, the area is fantastic.
reviews.title: not a 4* hotel- needs refurbishment
Well cared for
reviews.text: We arrived to be given a room that was a bit "tired", smelled of smoking with a poor view. We were immediately offered without question two other room options one of which was very good. The food in the evening was highly varied and good quality. The service was good and friendly. Our leaving flight was in the early hours of the morning. We were given our room to keep until we left at midnight without charge. We were well cared for. There was a bit of a sandy beach in front of the hotel. But a cheap and short bus journey away there was a lovely sheltered sandy beach suitable for swimming at Coral Bay.

reviews.title: Excellent Holiday!!!
reviews.text: We have just spent a week at the Louis Imperial and overall were more than pleased with the holiday. The hotel is exceptional and all the staff are really friendly. The rooms were quite basic but had all the facilities needed for the short time you spend in it. The breakfast and dinner was very nice and there was always a lot to choose from. The lunch was also excellent, however a little pricey. There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby that would provide similar quality for less, but the convenience of eating at the hotel was worth the cost. The pool area was very clean and the staff were always there to fetch you drinks and snacks from the pool bar. Staff offered complimentary cold towels and soft drinks during the day which was very nice. We couldn't of wished for a better animation team, thinking up original games that provided many laughs. They even managed to make bingo funny!! This was one of the best hotels we have been to and would certainly recommend it to anyone.

I stayed at this hotel in June/July 06 for 2 weeks with my husband and 2 year old daughter. The hotel is situated about 20-30 mins walk from the centre of Pathos and is a pleasent stroll at night, but a bit hot in the day, although there is a good regular bus service near the hotel which will take you into town / the market or to Coral Bay for about a £1. There are amenities and facilities close by to the hotel. There is a shop right next to the hotel for your drinks/snacks and ice-creams etc as the hotel prices are a bit expensive. There are also bars and restaurants located near the hotel if you fancy a change from eating in the restaurant. Having said that the food in the hotel is very good, both in choice and quality, it also provides a Childrens' menu at night time which seem to go down well with most of the children.
reviews.title: Decent hotel
nice hotel but rooms are not that impressive
reviews.text: The pool area, gardens and beach are all spotlessly clean with plenty of sunbeds and parasols for everyone and the hotel provide pool towels. The hotel staff come round at mid- day with cold face towels which were always welcome, and sometimes they came round with a free lemon drink - which was nice. There is entertainment around the pool area, aqua- areobics, bowls, quizzes, water polo etc, if you want that sort of thing, but the grounds around the hotel are a decent size so you can grab a quiet corner in the grounds, or on the beach, if you prefer.

reviews.title: fabulous food
reviews.text: Our room was a decent size and there was enough storage for all our things etc. However the hotel does charge for use of the fridge and safety deposit box - about £2 each per day.

We are currently staying at the Imperial 'cause of my brother's wedding. Wow... Hotel is great by all means. Staff are fantastic, really friendly and very courteous. There are out all the time serving guests, talking to us... wow, they are the friendliest people I've met.. The food is excellent, really out of this world; the buffet theme nights every night are sumptuous and attractive to all. Myself, I am a fussy eater but here I feel I have a personal chef at my disposal nightly.... Gorgeous displays, great variety! Rooms are in need of some refurbishing/updating for sure but still are kept spotless clean. My brother's wedding has been organized perfectly by the Thomson Representatives as well as by the hotel's wedding co-ordinator. Can not fault this hotel. Honestly.
reviews.title: Paradise Wedding, Perfect Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here in August and had the time of our lives. Rooms were spacious and clean. We had a room facing the sea and the view was absolutely breathtaking. Food was great. Staff were great, from waiters to management, all of them being helpful and friendly at all times. Nothing was trouble for them. They would do anything to make our stay as best as poss. The hotel is located 20mins walk from the fishing harbour and was lovely in the evening to take that stroll (right by the beach). Have stayed in this hotel 4 times in the past and this last holiday was by far the best. Well done to everyone at Imperial. See you next year!!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled to Louis Imperial Beach again this year for our wedding anniversary as usual last month but did so with some reservation. We have visited this hotel for some 8 - 10 times (sometimes twice a year) but this time did try to book another hotel but the one we wanted was full so we decided to take the risk and give it one more go. Sadly it is unlikely we will return given that this hotel has deteriorated since our stay last year.
reviews.title: Been coming here since 1996 - hugely disappointed, definitely not as good as last year!

reviews.text: As usual I emailed the hotel that we were returning but did not get a reply this time therefore called and spoke to the receptionist at the time who confirmed they had allocated us one of our preferred rooms. However, when we arrived we were shown to a room that was not one of our preferred. We requested a room from numbers 337 - 340 and were given keys to 337 which we thought was okay until I turned the bed down and saw bugs crawling. I thought it was just one but checked again and ants were crawling in the bed. We went to reception again and in turn were shown the rest of the rooms but they all had the same problem - ants in the bed or bedside cabinet drawers. Eventually after a couple of hours we settled into a room which did not have ants! My husband was livid by now so this got our holiday off to a bad start and we were disappointed to say the least. The rooms are pretty jaded and tired and really have remained the same since we first went there back in 1996, but had we been in our preferred room the view would have compensated somewhat. The location in itself is now not enough!
reviews.title: An amazing holiday

reviews.text: Elena tried to appease us and we appreciated it was not her fault but it was not good enough. We were sent a bottle of wine and some credit was applied to our bill.
reviews.title: great location,great hotel

reviews.text: Imperial was the perfect hotel for our perfect trip to Paphos. This hotel is located close to all. It is right on the beach. There is also a pool with lots of daytime entertainment. The entertaining staff is very friendly. For that matter, the whole staff was friendly and helpful. The buffet at the restaurant was very good. There was a different theme every night. Cypriot night was great. We got to try a lot of different types of local foods. We had a relaxing and fun vacation. We highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: FUN FOR ALL

reviews.text: Having been lucky enough through my husband's work to stay in some fantastic hotels around the world such as The Palace of the Lost City in Sun City, SA, this really is fab wee hotel and great value for money. Was a little wary after reading some the other reviews but I can honestly say they must have been very picky. We found the staff were more than helpful, food was excellent, entertainment team very enthusiastic (didn't push if you didn't want to take part), standard of cleanliness was excellent both inside and out. Yes the bedrooms are a little tired (our's was a double family room 367, with lovely view over pool and sea) but everything you needed was there and when the weather is fantastic outside we didn't want to be inside any more than necessary! We were all inclusive and my opinion is that's the best deal, includes breakfast, lunch and dinner along with late morning and midnight snacks though we never needed any snacks. Evening meals had theme nights, greek, chinese, indian to name few and were really good but there was always the carvery if you didnt want to try different food. Kids could go up to the pool bar and get their drinks as when needed with our A.I card but soon the bar staff got to recognise us and we didnt need to show it. Bar staff were all nice had some great laughs with Tanju and Emil, and we have never seen so many pretty, hardworking waitresses all in the one hotel! The evening restaurant has a strict dress code for men, long trousers and no sleeveless T-shirts and one guest was indeed refused entry on one occassion during our stay. Have read in other reviews that men complained it was too hot to wear long trousers but the air conditioning was on in the evenings. If I had one fault to mention it would be meal times - as meals are buffet style I was a bit shocked at some parents who were quite happy to let small children go up and help themselves then they would rush back to their tables, their plates held at all sorts of angles. Once my son had a plate of watermelon land at his feet from another child's plate and one morning at breakfast I had to help a little boy deal with a plate of pancakes he had dropped, crying his eyes out, parent no-where to be seen! Can't really blame the hotel for this but did mention on the hotel comment's form that perhap's they need to address situation? But don't let this put you off as food quality more than made up for a few thoughtless parent's. Can't give you any info on trips etc as we wanted a relaxing holiday by the pool and sea and that's exactly what we got. Beach a little rocky but water very clear and refreshing. If you want more peace and quiet then the garden loungers next to the beach provided this. There's a new footpath into Paphos Harbour area and takes about 25mins. We only went for a look but if you wanted anything to eat or drink there were lots of pavement restaurant's that looked nice. We did order a taxi from reception one day (10 euros each way) and an E- class mercedes took us into the older part of Paphos where we went to the local markets to buy some souvenirs. Got speaking to other guests around the pool and for many of them this was return visits to the hotel, and I would certainly go back there with my family.
reviews.title: Fab Holiday

reviews.text: I have to be honest, we would not ordinarily have chosen this hotel (our perference is boutique/5 star) but it had been picked for a family wedding. Situated close to Pafos the Louis Imperial is a fairly small and extremely friendly well run clean hotel with excellent facilities.
reviews.title: An absolute gem

reviews.text: Location and food are usually two key factors for us, and both were excellent. There are great easy walks around the coast and plenty of watersports facilities within a couple of minutes, as well as the town of Pafos. In terms of the food, with two food allergies this is usually a test for the kitchen. Not only did I have choice on this occasion, but I was taken around by the chef each evening, which is something I've only experienced in more expensive hotels. The food was of a high local quality, varied and always delicious.
reviews.title: fantastic holiday!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel also has an excellent entertainment team (including well run activities that you can dip into as you like) and a small protected beach at the end of the well kept gardens. While the rooms are pretty standard, apart from a softer pillow we did not need anything else. Most of all we were impressed by the staff, nothing was too much touble and they were always warm, helpful and incredibly efficient.
reviews.title: Relaxing

description: Surrounded by exotic gardens and only a few steps from the azure blue Mediterranean waters this 4 Star Paphos hotel invites you and your family or friends to experience a truly relaxing Cyprus holiday.
